definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: We filed out to the accompaniment of the organ.
sentences.chinese: 我們在管風琴伴奏下魚貫而出。

sentences.english: The old organ wheezed out a tune.
sentences.chinese: 那架老風琴嗚嗚地奏出曲子。

sentences.english: The all new collection from Blood Stream, with a 3D concertina background.
sentences.chinese: 新收集的所有從血液流，它具有三維手風琴的背景。

sentences.english: After the clang or of organ majestic, or chorus, or perfect band.
sentences.chinese: 當莊嚴的風琴，或者合唱隊，或整個樂團，演奏完了。

sentences.english: Shortly after, my lessons began with Mr. Zelli.
sentences.chinese: 不久，澤利先生開始教我拉手風琴。

sentences.english: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 但是那天下午，我別緻的手風琴好像變成了紙板盒。

sentences.english: When he was 15, and was working in a Church as an assistance organist, Ludwig was practically supporting the family.
sentences.chinese: 貝多芬15歲時就在教堂擔任助理風琴師，掙錢養家。

sentences.english: My little sister began to learn the accordion four.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹四歲時開始學拉手風琴。

sentences.english: An organ played, a choir sang, police guarded the doors.
sentences.chinese: 風琴鳴奏，合唱響起，警察守衛着各扇大門。

sentences.english: The accordion was in full blast in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 在大廳裏手風琴拉得非常響亮。

sentences.english: Further-more, Lucy can play the accordion (3) grace-fully and professionally.
sentences.chinese: 此外她還能拉出優美的手風琴曲，而且也很專業。

sentences.english: When they had finished he went round to the organist to make inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 試唱一結束，他就走過去向風琴師請教。

sentences.english: Shortly after, he also became organist at nearby St. Nicholas's.
sentences.chinese: 不久，他又成爲管風琴在附近的聖尼古拉斯的。

sentences.english: The organist was playing the congregation out.
sentences.chinese: 彈風琴的彈着風琴把會衆送了出去。

sentences.english: The organist was playing the congregation out.
sentences.chinese: 彈風琴的彈着風琴把會衆送了出去。

sentences.english: An accordion may have one panel open by default on initial display.
sentences.chinese: 手風琴導航默認可以有一個面板是展開的。

definition: to eject/to exit from/to pop up
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
